channel.title: Protocol decoder & encoder
channel.description: I'm working on a project on mudclient39, and need some hints/help on the decoders & encoders. I've done the renaming, Login is done(Haven't tested because I need encoder&decoder).I know how they work, but I have absolutely no idea where to start.

Well atm it is just a waste since its not being utilized so I wouldn’t see why not. Ask him.

item.title: Protocol decoder & encoder
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

[quote author=big hit link=topic=484268.msg3555807#msg3555807 date=1301872110]As somebody who has worked with VarekD extensively, I can say with certainty that VarekDs packet decoding/encoding are also broken.

Could you elaborate? I haven’t noticed any bugs from using it for over a year with anywhere from 0-535 players online at one given time.[/quote]
So you’re saying ur server uses Varekd’s encoders/decoders, What happened to the story of zilent fixing it for you?

Read full topic

item.title: Protocol decoder & encoder
item.dc:creator: @big_hit big hit
item.description:
@big_hit wrote:

IlikeArrays:

That is why it is in rscangel. k

RSCA’s decoders/encoders are very much custom to RSCA, AFAIK. VarekDs and RSCDaemons are very different from it, in any case.

Read full topic

item.title: Protocol decoder & encoder
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

That’s part of login mate. So when I sayed ‘login’ I meant everything related to it :), I know where the problem is now. Decoders & Encoders are wrong serverside. After first packet sent to client, client can’t receive more packets. I printed out all incoming packets from server->client on the method it receives them, all it gets right is the first packet i sent serverside, (PvPSettings)

Login response: 0
command:228
Got config
command:12
command:64
command:13
command:4
command:0
command:11
command:13

The rest are just random packets I haven’t even sent serverside

Managed to login(Finally), all packetbuilders are working except for playerposition builder, but i’ll do that tomorrow.
Was getting frustrated and tried asking few people help but they didn’t give a helping hand :(, Well atleast now I get all the credits.

Read full topic

item.title: Protocol decoder & encoder
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

Im at the same spot you are lol i got mc40 connecting to dark quest, except it just loads a black screen and then shows “lost connection”.

I also got it to display invalid user/pass, world is full, etc.(but thats not really important if you cant even play!)

Read full topic

item.title: Protocol decoder & encoder
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

Kryptix, I’m using the varekds fixed decoder&encoder…altough I got everything working now.

Now I got some other questions about how server->client works.

It accepts login and then I see black, because server isn’t sending correct Position.
I’ve renamed some parts of this playerpos update packet
to understand it and try to write a packetbuilder for it, it’s pretty a lot like RSCD’s posUpdater, but not the same.

So here are the questions of below code:
1.What’s the variable I renamed to “bboobobbo”?
2.After the first else statement I left things un-renamed, what are those?

[code]
if(command == 255)
{
int l1 = 1;
int bboobobbo = 0;
int mobCount = 0;
hu = true;
while(l1 < length)
{
int mobArrayIndex;
int mapEnterX;
int mapEnterY;
int sprite;
boolean flag;
if(bboobobbo == 0) {
mobArrayIndex = DataOperations.getUnsigned2Bytes(data, 1);
sectionX = DataOperations.getUnsigned2Bytes(data, 3);
sectionY = DataOperations.getUnsigned2Bytes(data, 5);
sprite = DataOperations.getUnsignedByte(data[7]);
l1 += 7;
loadSection(sectionX, sectionY);
sectionX -= areaX;
sectionY -= areaY;
mapEnterX = sectionX * magicLoc + 64;
mapEnterY = sectionY * magicLoc + 64;
if(sprite >= 128)
{
sprite -= 128;
flag = true;
} else
{
flag = false;
}
} else {
int i38 = DataOperations.getUnsigned2Bytes(data, l1);
int i34;
int k36;
if((i38 & 0xfc00) == 64512)
{
int i39 = DataOperations.getUnsigned2Bytes(data, l1 + 2);
l1 += 4;
i34 = i38 >> 5 & 0x1f;
if(i34 > 15)
i34 -= 32;
k36 = i38 & 0x1f;
if(k36 > 15)
k36 -= 32;
mobArrayIndex = i39 >> 4 & 0xfff;
sprite = i39 & 0xf;
if(sprite == 15)
{
sprite = 0;
flag = true;
} else
{
flag = false;
}
} else
{
int j39 = DataOperations.getUnsignedByte(data[l1 + 2]);
l1 += 3;
mobArrayIndex = i38 >> 6 & 0x3ff;
i34 = i38 >> 1 & 0x1f;
if(i34 > 15)
i34 -= 32;
k36 = (i38 << 4 & 0x10) + (j39 >> 4 & 0xf);
if(k36 > 15)
k36 -= 32;
sprite = j39 & 0xf;
if(sprite == 15)
{
sprite = 0;
flag = true;
} else
{
flag = false;
}
}
mapEnterX = (sectionX + i34) * magicLoc + 64;
mapEnterY = (sectionY + k36) * magicLoc + 64;
}
if(mobArray[mobArrayIndex] == null)
{
mobArray[mobArrayIndex] = new Mob();
mobArray[mobArrayIndex].serverIndex = mobArrayIndex;
mobArray[mobArrayIndex].mobIntUnknown = 0;
}
Mob mob = mobArray[mobArrayIndex];
if(bboobobbo == 0)
aw = mob;
boolean flag3 = false;
for(int j38 = 0; j38 < playerCount; j38++)
{
if(playerArray[j38] != mob)
continue;
flag3 = true;
break;
}
if(!flag3)
playerArray[playerCount++] = mobArray[mobArrayIndex];
if(flag3 && hu) {
mob.nextSprite = sprite;
int k39 = mob.waypointCurrent;
if(mapEnterX != mob.waypointsX[k39] || mapEnterY != mob.waypointsY[k39]) {
mob.waypointCurrent = k39 = (k39 + 1) % 10;
mob.waypointsX[k39] = mapEnterX;
mob.waypointsY[k39] = mapEnterY;
}
} else {
mob.serverIndex = mobArrayIndex;
mob.waypointEndSprite = 0;
mob.waypointCurrent = 0;
mob.waypointsX[0] = mob.currentX = mapEnterX;
mob.waypointsY[0] = mob.currentY = mapEnterY;
mob.nextSprite = mob.currentSprite = sprite;
mob.stepCount = 0;
if(!flag && !flag3)
mobArrayIndexes[mobCount++] = mobArrayIndex;
}
bboobobbo++;
}
if(mobCount > 0)
{
super.streamClass.createPacket(254);
super.streamClass.add2ByteInt(mobCount);
for(int currentMob = 0; currentMob < mobCount; currentMob++)
{
Mob dummyMob = mobArray[mobArrayIndexes[currentMob]];
super.streamClass.add2ByteInt(dummyMob.serverIndex);
super.streamClass.add2ByteInt(dummyMob.mobIntUnknown);
}

                super.streamClass.e();
                return;
            }
        } [/code]

EDIT:
The difference between 39 and 204 PlayerUpdate system is that 39 sends each type of update as a new packet, so with slight modification to the current RSCD PlayerUpdating system I could get it right…but still playing around with the Position updater…just can’t figure it out.

Read full topic
